page.title: 04North Tregony 1
page.content: The village of Tregony is cut into two parts by the D-block boundary, leaving the northern third in this block. Tregony is situated 8 miles east of Truro, the county town of Cornwall. It has a population of about 700 people including a high proportion of old age pensioners. The parish church is situated about half a mile away at Cornelly, so St. Cuby's church, which is at the northern edge of the village, is in fact used as the parish church; there is also a Methodist chapel on the main street. The affairs of the parish are run by a ten-member parish council. There are two schools: Tregony Primary was built in 1835 but burnt down and was later rebuilt; and The Roseland School, a modern comprehensive school (see pp.12 & 13).
